Articles.Content:
When building a space plane I'm finding I'm having problems with action groups. If, for example, a wing is added using the Mirror Part option and then other parts are added to the wing (say a shock cone and engine), everything is initially fine. But if II then make changes that require moving the wing, the mirrored parts forget their action group. The odd thing is that those parts still show up in the action list as normal. When you click on them however, you can see the option that was part of the action group needs re-adding.

Is there a way round this? It's becoming a pain having to recheck every action group to make sure its right after any change that removes then reattaches a mirrored part.

Edited October 5, 2015 by Clipperride
Not sure if anything can be done about it but rest assured it has always been that way. Sorry to say it but you'd better get used to it.

Ahh, I see. As long as its not just me, I don't feel quite so bad . Hopefully I'll start remembering to check it before an otherwise promising flight turns nasty when only the port side engines switch mode!
Claw's Stock Bug Fix Modules has a fix for symmetry action groups and lots of other stuff. I never play without them.
This is why I always wait until just before launching to do my action groups. It's also why I so often forget to do action groups.
